unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the World of Film Festivals (and why you should care!)
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the World of Film Festivals (and why you should care!)

unnormalised: Hey movie buffs! Ever wondered what happens behind the scenes before a Bollywood blockbuster hits your local PVR? Or how indie filmmakers from across the globe get their voices heard? The answer, my friend, is film festivals!
normalised: Hey movie buffs! Ever wondered what happens behind the scenes before a Bollywood blockbuster hits your local P V R? Or how indie filmmakers from across the globe get their voices heard? The answer, my friend, is film festivals!

unnormalised: Film festivals are like these giant movie melas – showcasing everything from big-budget productions to experimental shorts made with a shoestring budget. Think of the Cannes Film Festival, but maybe a little less… French. We have some amazing ones right here in India too!
normalised: Film festivals are like these giant movie melas – showcasing everything from big-budget productions to experimental shorts made with a shoestring budget. Think of the Cannes Film Festival, but maybe a little less… French. We have some amazing ones right here in India too!

unnormalised: Imagine this: you're chilling in Goa, soaking up the sun and then BAM! You stumble upon the International Film Festival of India (IFFI). Suddenly, you're watching a thought-provoking documentary about a village in Rajasthan, followed by a Q&A with the director! It’s an experience you can’t get anywhere else.
normalised: Imagine this: you're chilling in Goa, soaking up the sun and then B A M! You stumble upon the International Film Festival of India (I F F I). Suddenly, you're watching a thought-provoking documentary about a village in Rajasthan, followed by a Q and A with the director! It’s an experience you can’t get anywhere else.

unnormalised: But film festivals aren't just for cinephiles with encyclopedic knowledge of world cinema. They’re a fantastic place to discover new talent, network with industry professionals (maybe you’ll meet Karan Johar!), and see films that might never make it to mainstream theaters. Plus, the parties are legendary. Seriously.
normalised: But film festivals aren't just for cinephiles with encyclopedic knowledge of world cinema. They’re a fantastic place to discover new talent, network with industry professionals (maybe you’ll meet Karan Johar!), and see films that might never make it to mainstream theaters. Plus, the parties are legendary. Seriously.

unnormalised: Beyond entertainment, these festivals boost local economies. Think hotels booked, restaurants buzzing, and that random chaiwala earning Rs. 500 extra a day because of the increased foot traffic. Not to mention the prestige for the city hosting it!
normalised: Beyond entertainment, these festivals boost local economies. Think hotels booked, restaurants buzzing, and that random chaiwala earning rupees five hundred extra a day because of the increased foot traffic. Not to mention the prestige for the city hosting it!

unnormalised: There are tons of different festivals, each with its own vibe. Some focus on specific genres, like horror or animation, while others are all about promoting regional cinema. The National Film Archive of India (NFAI) often participates in these events, showcasing restored classics. It's like seeing Sholay in a whole new light!
normalised: There are tons of different festivals, each with its own vibe. Some focus on specific genres, like horror or animation, while others are all about promoting regional cinema. The National Film Archive of India (N F A I) often participates in these events, showcasing restored classics. It's like seeing Sholay in a whole new light!

unnormalised: So, next time you're planning a trip, check if there's a film festival happening nearby. You might just discover your next favorite filmmaker or stumble upon a hidden gem of a movie. Trust me, it’s an experience worth the 150 km drive!
normalised: So, next time you're planning a trip, check if there's a film festival happening nearby. You might just discover your next favorite filmmaker or stumble upon a hidden gem of a movie. Trust me, it’s an experience worth the one hundred and fifty kilometer drive!

unnormalised: And hey, even if you don't understand every single film, the post-screening chai and samosas are always a win! Happy watching!
